intro: Serjania glutinosa f. multiseta, commonly known as the sticky serjania or the multisetose serjania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, sticky resinous exudate on its bark and leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, with five petals, and are arranged in clusters. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, often with a waxy texture and a serrated margin.
